title: How about we switch Vaynes Passive and Silver bolts to make her damage more level dependant
body:
Even though this should be clear, the numbers are not the important part here but moreso the mechanic I propose to change.

Since the R-Buff where her Q gets reduced by 50% during her Ult, most Vaynes started to max Silver Bolts instead since the Q CD is low enough.

This has lead to her dealing too much damage way too fast into the game for a late game scaling hypercarry. You also weren't able to just level Silver Bolts up before the Q-Buff since then you dealt a lot of damage yes but you were sitting there like a wannabe Kog'Maw with short range. Your Q cooldown was just too high to survive.

What I propose is to switch Silver Bolts with her Passive, it would look like this:

**Passive: Silver Bolts**

Vayne's basic attacks and Condemn apply a Silver Bolts stack for 3.5 seconds, up to 3 times. Attacking a new enemy removes all stacks from the previous target.
The third stack consumes them all to deal 4% - 14% (based on level) max HP bonus true damage and capped at 200 against monsters.

**W: Night Hunter**
Cost: 20 Mana
Cooldown: 16/14/12/10/8 (starts when the ability is completely finished)

Vayne gains 20 movementspeed for 8 seconds, this effect is tripled when walking towards enemy champions and quadrupled during **Final Hour** (also only when walking towards enemy champions)

This change will make it so her DPS once again comes online way later into the game compared to now, however she will also have new ways to survive the early game to get to that state and also have a certain "downtime" the enemy can capitalize on thus also increasing her counterplay (which is badly needed).

You can compare this change to Tristana, her efficiency is also heavily tied to levels (her passive)

I mean, the truth is a carry like this shouldn't have % max health true damage (especially Fiora as well) because its a very stupid mechanic that has no counter (but dont buy health, right, realize they still have good physical damage in their kits, and procing that "low" true damage consistently means even having low health built wont make a difference).
Hate to say it, but % max health true damage needs to go period. Sure, people are gonna bitch "What about tanks? their only counter would be removed" and to that I point to % pen being buffed skyhigh. There is still a counter there and in Conqueror.

That or lower the respective % max hp true damage so much that it won’t be that much of a problem. Fiora is one of the worst top laners so I don’t think you need to worry about her lol. I have been spamming her for a week or two and honestly I don’t normally notice the damage of her vitals, Fiora specifically is only strong when tanks are mediocre/strong. When the champs that she is designed to counter are nerfed to the ground then she isn’t going to be that strong either.

I think that we should still keep the % max hp true damage in, but I think that in this meta we should keep them below 10% or even 5%. I think fiora’s should be higher than vayne’s, but that is because Fiora has a harder time accessing the true damage (vitals) while vayne’s true damage only requires her to auto attack. I’m thinking Vayne: 2%-4% and Fiora: 4%-10%.

But the general issue is that this mechanic has no counterplay. Its the specific reason why all of Fiora's damage is on a minigame (and Hash said it best, she's shit because of all the disgusting shit on her kit. Buffs only make the issue worse (i.e. make everyone in top hate fighting her, then she gets nerfed, then becomes shit, rinse repeat). She should go back to a simpler passive that gives her a duelist advantage and not some stupid minigame (and R could be made different).

And the reason why people want to cling to such damage is because people think the tank meta was the fault of tanks being too good. Guess people forgot ADCs being so good spurred that meta of protect the adc because they are all that matters (which got worse when enchanter items went overboard at worlds, creating the "fun" Ardent meta).
That's what they want lol

The idea of making Silver Bolts scale solely with levels is pretty OK.

Not a fan of making Night Hunter an active, though. Seems kind of unnecessary. Just make it a passive you put skill points into.

Or make Night Hunter a passive and active. Reminds me of Warwick kind of. She gets movespeed at all times, just low and can activate the spell for a quick boost. In the end I think either way would work though.

Or maybe: the silver bolt passive deals physical damage (most likely same ratios as her current W) but the night hunter “active” will make vayne’s silverbolts deal true damage.

Maybe also make this passive have the same unique name as the % physical damage from {{item:3153}} to avoid an even stronger first item powerspike from buying bork.
